column1: For a Pre-Licensed Operator Flow - mapped services and components data not getting auto-populate
column24:
Desc: US11019- Pre-Licensed Operator Flow
 
*Steps to reproduce:*
1. BZ Registration Officer logs into BZMS portal (Login dependency) 
2. Officer navigates to the dashboard and initiates a new Zone Profile creation request 
3. Officer fills the Basic Information section: Zone Name, Zone Type (from predefined types), State, ZATCA Representative .

4. Officer enters license for a pre-licensed operator (ZATCA licensed) .
5.Observe the result. Data doesn't get auto-populated.

Actual Result: *Data doesn't get auto-populated., when user enters the license number*

Expected Result: System automatically retrieves mapped services and components; manual input is disabled

column1: Foreign Trader-Data not populated after clicking Register as Operator.
column24:
Description
When the user clicks Register as Operator, the expected behavior is that all relevant details such as Establishment Name, Licensing Authority, and other associated data should be automatically populated on the page.

However, the system displays “No data available”, leaving the fields empty.
 
Expected Result
All relevant data (Establishment Name, Licensing Authority, etc.) should be populated automatically after clicking Register as Operator.
Actual Result
Page shows No data available.
Fields like Establishment Name and Licensing Authority remain empty.
Steps to Reproduce
Navigate to the operator registration section.
Click Register as Operator.

column1: Incorrect error message displayed for duplicate tenant creation.
column24:
Expected: Error message should be "Tenant already exist".
Actual: Submission ,Unable to save the details. Please try again.
Steps to Reproduce:
1.    Log in as Operator.
2.    Navigate to account management dashboard.
3.    Attempt to add a tenant with duplicate details.

column1: Request Details page displays “N/A” for key fields after submission, and the request does not appear on the dashboard—blocking the amendment flow.
column24:
*Description: US11403*
Request Details page displays “N/A” for key fields after submission, and the request does not appear on the dashboard—blocking the amendment flow.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Log in as Operator to BZMS portal.
 # Navigate to account management -> Trader Details
 # Click on add new trader.
 # Fill bonded zone details
 # Fill Trader details, Move to summary.
 # Click on Submit button.
 # Request is Generated.
 # Click on view request, observe request details page:

 

*Actual:*
 * Request Details shows *“N/A”* for key fields and *request details page is blank.*
 * Request not visible on Dashboard.
 * Amendment flow is blocked as no entry is generated and no data is present in the table

*Expected:*
 * Request Details should display all submitted values correctly.
 * Request should appear on the Dashboard immediately.
 * Amendment actions should be available for the submitted request.

{*}Please find request response for the same{*}: 
Request URL:
[https://sit-api-bzms.zatca.gov.sa/api/v1/sor/operator-trader/request/251221014022459946]
RESPONSE: 
{
    "Success": false,
    "Data": null,
    "Message":

{         "en": "The requested path is invalid or incomplete. Please ensure all required path parameters are provided.",         "ar": "المسار المطلوب غير صالح أو غير مكتمل. يرجى التأكد من توفير جميع معلمات المسار المطلوبة."     }

,
    "CorrelationId": null,
    "Status": 404,
    "ErrorCode": "RES_404",
    "ErrorType": "NoHandlerFoundException"
}

column1: After amendment submission, “View Request” button redirects to the same submit page instead of displaying the request details page.
column24:
When verifying that an operator can amend tenant information, the following issue occurs:
 * After clicking {*}Submit{*}, a success message is displayed along with *Go to Dashboard* and *View Request* buttons.
 * Clicking *View Request* does *not* open the request details page; instead, it redirects back to the same submit page.

Expected Result

Clicking View Request should open the request details page showing the amended tenant information.

Actual Result

System redirects to the same submit page.
Request details page is not displayed.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Navigate to tenant details page.
 # Click {*}Amend{*}, update tenant information, and click {*}Submit{*}.
 # On success message screen, click {*}View Request{*}. !image-2025-12-21-18-53-38-484.png!!image-2025-12-21-18-52-54-698.png!

column1: Save Draft throws “submission failed”
column24:
*Description: US11403*
Save Draft throws “submission failed”

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Log in as Operator to BZMS portal.
 # Navigate to account management -> Trader Details
 # Click on add new trader.
 # Fill bonded zone details.
 # Fill Trader details and click on {*}Save Draft{*}.

*Actual:*
System displays error: “submission failed” and draft is not saved.

*Expected:*
Save Draft should persist the current state without errors and confirm draft saved.

column1: Tenant amendment request does not update after amendment by operator in BZMS Portal.
column24:
h3. *Expected Result*
 * Tenant amendment request should reflect the updated value after amendment.

h3. *Actual Result*
 * Tenant name remains the same as before the amendment. Not visible in BZMS Portal.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Navigate to the tenant details page.
 # Click *Amend* and update the tenant name.

column1: Trader name selected on the Trader Details page is not displayed correctly on the Step 3 Summary section.
column24:
*Description: US11403*
Trader name selected on the Trader Details page is not displayed on the Step 3 Summary section.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Log in as Operator to BZMS portal.
 # Navigate to account management -> Trader Details
 # Click on add new trader.
 # Fill bonded zone details
 # Proceed to *Trader Details* and select a trader -applies to both Full Control and Partial Control flows.
 # Continue to the *Summary* page -Step 3.

*Actual:*
Trader name field shows incorrect data while submitting the request.

*Expected:*
Selected trader name should be displayed correctly in the Summary section for both Full and Partial control flows.

column1: When a Foreign Trader requests to be an Operator, the view request functionality is not navigating to the current application request.
column24:
*Description:*
When a Foreign Trader requests to be an Operator, fills in all mandatory details and submits the request, it is getting submitted successfully but when we click on view request, it is navigating to only one application which is already approved by the ZATCA Officer every time.

Reported by Pavan Kumar

*Steps to reproduce*
1. Login to the BZMS portal as a Foreign Trader
2. Account Management -> Register as an Operator
3. Add details and submit
4. Observe the Application number/ID
5. Click on the view request
6. Observe the Application ID, Submission date and ZATCA Decision

{*}Actual result{*}: Every time a new request is getting submitted, View request button is navigating to the same application submitted on 17/12 which is already approved.
{*}Expected Result{*}: When we click on the view request, it should navigate us to the current application and show the date of submission as current date and decision as Pending.

column1: Approval flow must be done 3 times as the Supervisor for the status to be changed to RESOLVED COMPLETED
column24:
When a zone type creation request is sent and has to be approved by the supervisor, the approval flow is iterating *three times* for the status to be reflected as *Resolved completed*

*Steps to reproduce:*
1.Create a zone type request as officer
2.Login as Supervisor and search for the created request
3.Approve the request
4.Observe the flow

*Actual result:*
*1.When the supervisor approves the request for the first time the status changes to - Approved by officer*
*!FirstApproval.png|width=349,height=163!*
*2.The supervisor clicks on "GO" again and approves for the second time status changes to - Approved by Supervisor*
*!SeondApproval.png|width=410,height=164!*
{*}3.{*}{*}The supervisor clicks on "GO" again and approves for the third time status changes to - Resolved completed{*}
*!ThirdApproval.png|width=550,height=236!*

*EXPECTED RESULT: The supervisor should be able to approve the request in one go and the status should be changed to "resolved completed"*

column1: Zone type creation - Zone description should be named as only "Description" as per FIGMA

Open any Zone Type record.

Password: Zatca@123

column1: Operator is able to approve only for few of the zone profile, not for all/newly created zone profiles through BZMS officer portal
column24:
*Description:* 
 
When a Local trader creates a new authorization request and submits it for operator’s approval, the submitted application number is not searchable as it was created for a particular zone profile. The operator is able to approve the authorization requests for only specific zone profile (example: Testing zone SIT Three) 
 
 

*Steps to reproduce* 
1. Login as a Local trader 
2. Create a new request for authorization(Zone profile management->Add zone profile) 
3. Select zone profile as Zone profile test 1 
4. Complete the authorization form and submit 
5. Login as Operator and search for the application 
6. Observe the result 
 

*Actual result:* Created authorization request is not searchable.  

*Expected result:* The authorization request should be displayed when searched using application number
column359: 21/Dec/25 10:30 AM;ybaba-c; [~smishra-c] Could you please help us with a zone profile which has multiple components. ;;;

column1: No error message displayed during login while wrong password is entered for Local/Foreign Trader/Operator
column24:
*Description:* 
During the login for Local/Foreign Trader/Operator through the front end BZMS portal no error message is being displayed if wrong password is entered and Login button is clickable 
 

*Steps to reproduce* 
1. Launch the FE BZMS portal 
2. Enter valid TIN number (1234567890) 
3. Enter wrong password(eg.gedwggdy) 
4.Click on login
5.Observethe behaviour 

 

*Actual result:* Login button is clickable, and no error is displayed for wrong password.  

*Expected result:* Wrong password entered message should be displayed.

column24:

column1: In Create Component screen, Basic Details section does not match Figma – missing fields, incorrect fields and incorrect labels
column24:
h5. *Description:*
h5. In the Add Component screen, the Basic Details section in the actual application does not match the  Figma design.

Several discrepancies have been observed including missing mandatory fields, incorrect field names, additional unwanted fields, and missing helper text.As per Figma, the Basic Details section must contain the following fields:
 * Type‑code/ID*
 * Component title*
 * Description

h5. However, the actual screen displays incorrect field such as Building Name and incorrect labels.{*}Steps to Reproduce:{*}
 # Login to the BZMS backend officer portal.
 # Navigate to Create → Create Component.
 # Observe the Basic Details section and compare it with the Figma design.

h3. *Actual Result:*
h5. The Basic Details section shows the following issues:
 * “Component title” field is missing.
 * An incorrect field “Building Name” is displayed (not part of Figma).
 * Field labels do not match Figma:
 ** “Component type/Code ID” instead of “Type‑code/ID”
 ** “Component Description” instead of “Description"
 * !image-2025-12-17-18-10-05-229.png|width=548,height=242!

----
h3. Expected Result:
h5. The Basic Details section should match the Figma design and include:
 * 
h5. Correct fields: Type‑code/ID*, Component title*, Description

 * 
h5. No additional or incorrect fields (e.g., Building Name)

 * 
h5. Correct field labels matching Figma terminology

!image-2025-12-17-18-14-00-873.png|width=594,height=198!
column358: 18/Dec/25 5:47 PM;anssharma-c;Fixed and Deployed.;;;

21/Dec/25 10:01 AM;anssharma-c;HEllo [~ybaba-c] this is developed as per story 5. BZ Registration Officer enters example details such as: 
o Building Name: “Main Storage Building” 
o Child Component: “Warehouse A” under the Main Storage Building 
• 
o Sub-Component: “Shelf A1” under Warehouse A

column1: Unable to create sub-service – Error message displayed during submission.
column24:
h3. *Expected Result*
 * Service form should display correctly.
 * Sub-service fields should accept valid input:
 ** *Sub Service Code ID*
 ** *Sub Service Title*
 * KPI fields should populate automatically.
 * Sub-service should be created successfully and linked as required.

h3. *Actual Result*

Unable to create sub-service; error message is displayed during submission.

Error- 
 * *The Flow Action post-processing transform rule ValidateMasterDataZoneProperties failed: InvalidReferenceException*
 * *InvalidReferenceException .SubServiceTest Property 'SubServiceTest' does not exist on class 'Zatca-BZMS-Data-SubServiceDetails'*
 
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Log in to the BZMS portal.
 # Navigate to {*}Create Sub-Service{*}.
 # Fill in all mandatory fields (Sub Service Code ID, Title, KPI fields).
 # Click {*}Submit{*}.
 # Observe the error message and failure to create sub-service.
column358: 17/Dec/25 3:36 PM;anssharma-c;Ready for retest;;;
column359: 17/Dec/25 5:20 PM;ybaba-c;Thank You.. Now able to create Sub Services.;;;
column361:
21/Dec/25 10:16 AM;anssharma-c;Hello this is developed as per story's happy scenario : Happy Scenario 3: *Create a new sub service that can be linked with main service later* 
1. BZ Registration Officer will log into BZMS portal (backend officer portal) as per (login user story “dependency”) 
2. BZ Registration Officer will access their dashboard to identify which requests can be submitted for bonded zone services 
3. BZ Registration Officer will select to add a new bonded zone sub service 
4. The BZ Registration Officer will complete the service addition form, which includes (but is not limited to) Sub–Service Title and description, with the service type specified as a sub service 
5. The Registered BZ Registration Officer, continues to fill in the Service Details including the KPIs by selecting the KPI type needed for the sub service quality evaluation 
6. The Registered BZ Registration Officer, then goes ahead and submits the sub service Addition form 
7. The Registered BZ Registration Officer’s, sub service addition request status will then be stated as "Submitted"

 

RCA: Not a bug

 

NEeds to be rejected;;;

column1: HS Code is not displayed on the Approval screen after performing an amendment in the Master UOM record.
column24:
+*Description:*+
When amending a Master UOM, the user manually enters the *HS Code* and submits the amendment request. The request then moves to the *BZ Supervisor* for approval.
However, when the Supervisor opens the request and views the amendment details, the {*}HS Code value does not appear{*}. The field is shown as blank, even though the user had entered it during the amendment.
 
+*Steps to reproduce:*+
 # Login to BZMS Officer Backend portal as BZ Registration Officer.
 # Click on Create button then select Amend Master UOM option.
 # Select the Master UOM from the displayed list for which you want to perform amend operation. and click on Submit.
 # Enter the the HS code in amendment screen.
 # Click on 'Submit' button.
 # Once the request is created it will be routed to BZ Supervisor for the approval.
 # Now Login to BZMS Officer Backend portal as BZ Supervisor.
 # Open the amendment request created in Step6.
 # Observe the HS code details 

+*Actual Result:*+

The HS Code field is blank on the Approval screen.
The value entered during amendment is not displayed to the Supervisor.

!image-2025-12-16-20-17-35-770.png|width=541,height=243!

+*Expected Result:*+ 
The HS Code entered during amendment should be displayed correctly on the Supervisor’s Approval screen.

Refer the Attachments for the Screenshots;;;

column1: Incorrect title displayed as “Create Amend Master UOM” with ID increments each time; should display “Amend Master UOM” without visible ID
column24:
+*Description:*+
On the Amend Master UOM selection screen, the title currently shows “Create Amend Master UOM (AMEND-UOM-40)”, which is incorrect for an amend operation.
Additionally, the ID in parentheses (AMEND-UOM-40) increments by one each time the screen is opened. This ID should not be visible in the title.

+*Steps to reproduce:*+
1.    Login to the BZMS Portal (backend officer portal) as BZ Registration Officer
2.    Click Create-> Amend Master UOM
3.    Navigate to Amend Master UOM flow.
4.    Observe the title at the top.
•    Displays “Create Amend Master UOM (AMEND-UOM-XX)” instead of “Amend Master UOM”.
•    The ID increments each time the screen is opened (e.g., AMEND-UOM-40 → AMEND-UOM-41).

+*Actual result:*+ 
 -    Title shows “Create Amend Master UOM” instead of “Amend Master UOM”.
 -    ID is visible in the title and increments unnecessarily each time the screen is accessed

+*Expected result:*+ 
 -    Title should correctly display “Amend Master UOM” for amend operations. 
 -    ID should not be shown in the title during amend operations.

+*Reported By:*+ Yogiraj Baba
column358: 18/Dec/25 11:51 AM;anssharma-c;|This is a product limitation, we need to raise an SR to fix this- INC-C58806|;;;

column1: Alternative UOM Code/ID and Size Code auto-increment after clearing the field and clicking outside the field
column24:
+*Description:*+
In the Amend/Freeze Master UOM screen, when a user clears the value in the Alternative UOM Code/ID field or the Size code field (using Backspace/Delete) and then clicks outside the field, the ID/Code increments by one automatically. This happens each time the user erases and clicks outside, leading to unintended auto-incrementing codes.
Observed in sections:
•    Alternate UOM details → Alternative UOM Code/ID
•    Applicable sizes → Size code


+*Steps to reproduce:*+
1.    Login to the BZMS Portal (backend officer portal) as BZ Registration Officer
2.    Select Amend Master UOM option to navigate to Amend screen.
3.    Scroll to Alternate UOM details. 
4.    In Alternative UOM Code/ID field: 
•    Remove the existing value completely using Backspace/Delete.
•    Click anywhere outside the field.
•    Observe that the value changes to an incremented ID.
•    Repeat the same steps for the Size code field in Applicable sizes section.
•    Repeat multiple times—each time the code increments by one.

+*Actual result:*+

After clearing the field and clicking outside, the Alternative UOM Code/ID and Size code fields auto-populate with an incremented value (e.g., from SUOM-40 to SUOM-41)

!image-2025-12-16-08-49-25-940.png|width=409,height=189!

 

!image-2025-12-16-08-51-25-594.png|width=411,height=191!

+*Expected result:*+

column1: Create Zone Profile - Bonded Zone Activation date is accepting any past date
column24:
*Description:* 
When Officer is trying to create a zone profile the bonded zone activation date is accepting any date which is past the current date which is not logically correct as we are creating a new zone profile on the current date. 

 
*Steps to reproduce* 
1. Login to the BZMS (backend) as an Officer  
2. Click on Create Zone Profile  
3. Add all the mandatory details  
4.Add the authorization date any date which is past the current date 
5.Observe the error message 

 
*Actual result:* Any past date is being accepted  
*Expected result:* Either current date or future date needs to be accepted

column1: More Information Required Action for Authorization request of Local Trader/Foreign Trader is not working as expected
column24:
*Description:*
Once the Operator Requests for more Information, Foreign Trader/local trader is not able to add information needed as edit option is not working but Operator can see Information Received.




*Steps to reproduce*
 # Login to the BZMS as an Foreign trader/Local trader
 # Click on Zone Profile Management -> Add Zone Profile
 # Under bonded zone details relevant Select Zone profile and components and enter authorization start and end date
 # Click on next and in the summary, page click on submit
 # Login as Operator
 # Click on Incoming Request
 # Search for the created Application -> view details -> Take action -> More Info
 # Enter More Information needed in the text box and submit
 # Observe the Status as “Information Received”
 # Login as FT
 # View details of the current request
 # Observe the edit option.

 

*Actual result:* Edit Option not working for FT to enter the information required but operator can see Information Received.

*Expected result:* FT must be able to click on edit -> enter information required that is requested by the Operator and resubmit the request.

 

*Note:* Issue Common for both Local and Foreign trader login

column1: Rejection flow of Authorization request of Local trader / Foreign trader not working as expected. No text box to enter rejection reason

4. Click on next and in the summary, page click on submit  
5. Login as Operator 
6. Click on Incoming Request 
7. Search for the created Application -> view details -> Take action -> Reject Request  
8. Observe the action being performed -> directly being rejected  
  

*Actual result:* Request being rejected without asking for reason. Rejected status marked as green

*Note:* Issue common for both Foreign trader and local trader

column1: PEGA UI partially loads after login, API calls fail (500/401)
column24:
After logging into the BZMS Pega application (Constellation UI), the front-end renders static elements (navigation, announcements, work queue) but fails to load dynamic content or allow actions. Multiple API calls to {{/prweb/app/bzms/api/*}} return {*}500 Internal Server Error{*}, and at least one GET call returns {*}401 Unauthorized{*}. This occurs for *all roles* (Operator, Supervisor, Officer).
 
 * Navigate to the BZMS login page.
 * Log in with any valid credentials (Operator / Supervisor / Officer).
 * Observe:
 ** Left navigation loads (Home, Bonded Zone Services, Dashboard).
 ** Announcements widget and Pulse section visible.
 ** Work Queue shows tasks with *Submitted* status.
 * Open {*}DevTools → Console{*}:
 ** Multiple {{POST}} requests fail with {*}500 Internal Server Error{*}.
 ** One {{GET}} request fails with {*}401 Unauthorized{*}.
 ** Errors logged in {{xhr.js:195}} and {{StateResolver.js:257}} as {{{}ERR_BAD_RESPONSE{}}}.
 * Refresh or log in with another role → same issue persists.
column358: 10/Dec/25 9:22 PM;anssharma-c;Hello [~ybaba-c]  can you share the screenshot of what is partially loading, these API failures should not hamper the landing UI. we will check on these failures.;;;
column359:
11/Dec/25 10:06 AM;anssharma-c;Hello [~ybaba-c] Please close this defect as this is not applicable.

o    Pega has several internal calls which are not related to our development but are configured in the constellation framework. 
o    Testing shouldn’t be done using console for Backend officer portal as it has no relevance on the development done within Backend portal.
o    As for this defect, PEGA’s performance and functionality is not impacted. ;;;
column360: 12/Dec/25 10:00 AM;taeltayyeb-c;Kindly note that this was not fixed yet;;;
column361: 14/Dec/25 8:26 PM;anssharma-c;These are all OOB API calls. Please provide screenshot of how pega UI is partially loading and what is missing. [~taeltayyeb-c] ;;;
column362: 15/Dec/25 7:38 AM;shgandhi-c;[~anssharma-c] - Uploaded the attachment, will close this issue with valid justification or documentation. ;;;

column1: Bonded Zone Tenant created successfully but Notification not triggered.
column24:
Expected: Tenant should be added successfully with all details displayed and notification triggered.

Actual: Bonded Zone Tenant created successfully but Notification not triggered. 

Steps to Reproduce: 
1.    Log in as Operator. 
2.    Navigate to account management dashboard. 
3.    Add a new tenant with all required details. 
4.    Observe tenant list and notification behavior.

column1: “Go To Dashboard” post registration redirects incorrectly / logs out after creating Zone Profile
column24:
Description 
•    Expected: After registration or successful login, clicking Go To Dashboard should route the operator to the Zone Profile Management dashboard with options to create/manage zone profiles. 
•    Actual: Clicking Go To Dashboard results in wrong redirection (unexpected page) or forced logout. 

Steps to reproduce 
1.    Register as a new BZ Operator (or use newly created operator account). 
2.    Create zone profile with all necessary details.

3. On the confirmation page, click Go To Dashboard.

4.    Observe navigation result: page not Zone Profile dashboard OR session ends/logs out.

column1: Components/Services cannot be added unless Zone Type = “Internal Zone Profile”
column24:
Description 
•    Expected: After selecting any valid Zone Type from the predefined list (e.g., Industrial, Commercial), operator can add Components (Type, Name, Location) and map Services per component, restricted to the pre linked set for that Zone Type. 
•    Actual: Components and services addition dropdown is empty unless the Zone Type is specifically “Internal Zone Profile”. Other valid Zone Types do not allow component/service mapping.

Steps to reproduce 
1.    Log in as BZ Operator to the front end portal. 
2.    Click Create New Zone Profile from dashboard. 
3.    In Basic Information, select a Zone Type other than “Internal Zone Profile” (e.g., Industrial). 
4.    Proceed to Components section and attempt to add Component Type, Name, Location. 
5.    Proceed to Services section and attempt to map services to the added component(s). 
6.    Observe the behavior (buttons disabled, validation blocking, or errors).
